snippet: Proposals to remake its court system and create a civilian review board for the Police Department speak to longstanding grievances in the black community.
abstract: Editorial holds that racially torn Ferguson, Mo, took important step when City Council announced proposals aimed at remaking its troubled court system and creating civilian review board of Police Department; contends initiatives speak to longstanding grievances in black community, and are meant to defuse racial tensions that erupted into riots in wake of death of Michael Brown; warns that reforms need to be adopted by neighboring towns in order to be meaningful.
lead_paragraph: Proposals to remake its court system and create a civilian review board for the Police Department speak to longstanding grievances in the black community.

headline.main: A Step Toward Fairness in Ferguson
